meanings.definition: The quality of being easy to approach or use.
meanings.sent1: The accessibility of the playground made it easy for children of all abilities to play together.
meanings.sent2: The new ramp improved the accessibility of the building for wheelchair users.
meanings.sent3: The accessibility of the puzzle was so simple that even a young child could solve it.
meanings.sent4: Her warm smile and friendly demeanor created an accessibility that drew people to her effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The online tutorial enhanced the accessibility of learning new skills from home.

meanings.definition: The ability to be easily reached or entered.
meanings.sent1: The accessibility of the store from the main road attracted many customers.
meanings.sent2: The accessibility of the emergency exit was crucial during the fire drill.
meanings.sent3: The accessibility of the secret garden was so inviting that everyone wanted to explore it.
meanings.sent4: His open-door policy symbolized the accessibility of his leadership style.
meanings.sent5: The keycard provided exclusive accessibility to the restricted area.

meanings.definition: The extent to which a product, device, service, or environment is usable by as many people as possible.
meanings.sent1: The accessibility of the website was enhanced by adding text-to-speech features.
meanings.sent2: The accessibility of the public transportation system benefited many commuters.
meanings.sent3: The accessibility of the all-you-can-eat buffet led to a line of hungry customers.
meanings.sent4: The universal design of the building increased its accessibility to people with diverse needs.
meanings.sent5: The inclusive playground was designed with accessibility in mind for children of all abilities.
